name: Sequoyah: American Indian Leader Quiz | People | 5 Questions

questions.text: What was Sequoyah's great invention and perhaps most outstanding achievement?
What English name did Sequoyah go by?
questions.explanation:
George Gist.

	His mother was sister to the white man, Nathaniel Gist, a friend of George Washington, thus Sequoyah's English names.

questions.text: A county in what state is now named for Sequoyah?
In what state can you find Sequoia National Park, also named for Sequoyah?
In 1842, Sequoyah left on an ill-fated search for a legendary lost Cherokee tribe. In what country did he end up dying?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	He died in San Fernando, Mexico, never having reached his goal of finding the lost tribe.
